Job Posting: 178365 - Position: S26 Product Management Intern 178365 Co-op Work Term Posted: 2026 - Summer App Deadline Application Method: Posting Goes Live: Job Posting Status: 02/28/2026 11:59 PM Through Employer Website 02/17/2026 12:25 PM Approved ORGANIZATION INFORMATION Organization Address Line 1 City Postal Code / Zip Code Province / State Country Interac Corp. Suite 2400 - 200 Bay Street Toronto M5J 2J1 ON Canada JOB POSTING INFORMATION Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Work Mode Salary Currency Salary Salary Range $ Job Description Who We Are: 2026 - Summer S26 Product Management Intern 178365 Co-op Position Toronto, ON Canada 4 months Hybrid CAD 0.0 per hour for 0 Major List $21 to $23 Every transaction matters. Every Canadian matters. At Interac, we protect both - driving trust, security, and inclusion, so our digital economy thrives. Founded in 1984, Interac connects Canadians through secure digital payments, advanced identity verification and industry-leading fraud protection. Connecting banks, businesses, and individuals, Interac enables millions to send, receive, and manage money safely and effortlessly every day - across both digital and physical environments. As the backbone of Canada's financial ecosystem, Interac facilitates over 20 million transactions daily, supported by trusted partnerships with government and financial institutions. Consistently ranked as Canada's most reputable financial technology brand, Interac is deeply embedded in the daily lives of Canadians. Who You Will Work With: We are looking for a Product Management Intern to join our team and gain hands-on experience in building and improving products that impact our customers. This internship offers an opportunity to collaborate with cross-functional teams, define product strategies, and contribute to the product development lifecycle. If you're passionate about technology, problem-solving, and customer experience, this role is for you! The intern will join Interac's Verified product team, working closely with product managers, engineers, designers, and business stakeholders. You will contribute to shaping product features, gathering insights, and driving key initiatives. Please note: There are two similar but different Product Management Intern job postings available. Those studying computer science, business or engineering are strongly encouraged to apply to this role as the ideal candidate has some technical experience. What You Will Do: • Support the Product team in day-to-day activities with stakeholder groups (squads, sales, engineering, marketing, and design) to address product-related issues and concerns • Provide general support to the product roadmap, defining requirements, conducting product research, and assisting in squads to deliver corporate objectives • Assist with general product programs and initiatives, including participation in squad activities (sprints), documenting requirements, and contributing to the product roadmap • Analyze product dynamics and business needs and recommend prioritization of roadmap items • Conduct market research and analyze user feedback to identify opportunities for product improvements. • Collaborate with engineering, design, and marketing teams to support product launches • Help track product performance metrics and analyze data to inform decision-making • Participate in user testing, gather insights, and make recommendations for UX/UI improvements • Research, analyze, and maintain information systems in support of the product roadmap using tools like Jira, Figma, and other product tools • Prepare documentation and conduct research as requested by the squad and/or product team Document and communicate product updates to stakeholders • Job Requirements What You Bring: • Currently completing an undergraduate degree from a creditable Canadian institution with a focus on Business, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field • Strong analytical, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills • Excellent written and verbal communication skills • Ability to collaborate in a cross-functional environment and work independently • Familiarity with product development processes and agile methodologies • Analytical thinking and ability to quantify customer needs, pain points and product value - you have an ability to deliver actionable recommendations in a timely manner • Ability to conduct market research, competitor analysis, and gather user feedback • You have a strong growth mindset - you're willing to work and learn outside of your main functional expertise to meet the goals of your team • Understanding that success is in the details - you tend to notice things that others don't • Proficiency in the Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook, Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Power BI, MS Teams) with a preference for working knowledge of Excel • Experience with product management tools like Jira/Confluence, Figma, Lucid Chart/Spark, Tableau • Although not required, you have some familiarity or previous experience with the following: • Product management experience • Product development experience (in technical or business analysis functions) • Strong working understanding of Agile Prior experience in primary and/ or secondary research, pricing and financial analysis, and/or consulting • Citizenship Requirement N/A APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through Employer Website Special Application Instructions Please click the "I intend to apply to this position" button on SCOPE and also submit your application via the employer's website. Application Link: https://interac.wd3.myworkdayjobs.com/en-US/Interac/job/Toronto/Product-Management-Intern_REQ- 2099?q=intern Applications are accepted on a rolling basis and the posting may be expired at any time by the employer as submissions are received. Students should submit their applications as soon as they are ready.
